title: Development of Mathematical Problem-Solving Strategies Using Social Cognitive Learning Modeling

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Mathematical Concepts (Functions, Statistics, Geometry) and Leadership Experience
context.additional_context: A blended environment combining smartphone-based mobile learning with small-group offline activities, where learners must immediately apply mathematical problem-solving skills in workplace settings.

learning_goals: Learners can explore and compare various explanatory models to select the most suitable explanatory framework for mathematical problem-solving.
Learners can adjust and develop their awareness of mathematical problem-solving abilities through interaction with peer learners.
Learners can implement problem-solving cases using an advanced-level (integration) explanatory framework (basic-application-integration) with 80% accuracy.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
